reviews.review: le jeu est excellent mais toute l'expérience est gâchée par un matchmaking absolument désastreux, c'est un véritable problème puisque cela empêche le joueur d'avoir une courbe de difficulté décente, on peut avoir le rang le plus bas du jeu et affronter des joueurs avec le plus haut rang, pour comparer c'est comme faire s'affronter des joueurs de lol ne fer 2 contre des challenger ça n'a aucun sens et c'est extrêmement frustrant, c'est très difficile de jouer détente sur ce jeux au vu de ce problème qui persiste depuis si longtemps, je crois qu'une partie sur 30 est à peu près convenable en terme de matchmaking et encore je suis gentil, ce problème gâche vraiment mon expérience de jeu...

This game is horrifying. I came here expecting a nice time. But instead every time I load into any game there's a killer there trying to murder me. I'm stuck trying to fix these generators and I'm definitely not an electrician. I have these other people around me getting brutally injured and they're expecting me to heal them. I'm definitely not a doctor. And the only actual doctor I've seen DEFINITELY didn't have anyone's best interest in mind. Someone needs to report that man for breaking the Hippocratic Oath. If someone could send an Uber to come pick me up that'd be great. Tired of needing to patch myself up continuously.

This game is dope.

No ultrawide (21:9 or 32:9) support. It's 16:9 with the top and bottom cut off. The character takes up a third of the screen. And to top it off: You can't even change the resolution in-game. Literally unplayable.
BBQ & Copium :')

Putting toxicity aside, the game is pretty fun. Its gameplay is unique in comparison to other games. DBD is in the ''easy to learn, hard to master'' category. Fortunately, the game is not ''pay to win''. The only things you can buy with real money are cosmetics and new characters. The process of leveling up a character cannot be sped up, you have to work for it. The ranking in this game does not really matter, don't get obsessed with ranking up, this is the wrong way to play it. Dying as a survivor or not killing everyone as a killer will not always mean defeat, remember that.
Having all your favorite horror characters in one universe sounds amazing and that's what encouraged me to buy it in the first place. They managed to fit these characters very well and even lore-wise it makes sense in a way.
There is and will always be a war in the community regarding whether the game is killer-sided or survivor-sided. I don't have an opinion concerning this topic. I don't recommend visiting the game's official forums, [u]just don't[/u], for your own sake. It will only ruin your day.
Anyway, hopefully, this was helpful to someone.

このゲームはキラー側サバイバー側と別れてカクレンボをするゲームです。
キラーはサバイバーを発見次第攻撃→ダウン→フックにつるすという工程を行い
3回フックにつるすことによってサバイバーを処刑することができ、4人のサバイバーを処刑できれば
キラー側の勝利となります。

キラー側の視点がFPS視点
サバイバー側の視点が三人称視点となっており、
接近戦攻撃をする必要があるキラー側は攻撃が当てにくく、
サバイバー視点は視点を動かすだけで索敵がしやすく、また逃げる方向を見ながら
相手を見つつ攻撃をかわしやすい環境となっております。
壁越しにも周りを見やすいので、操作がしやすいです。

両方ともFPS視点、または三人称視点であれば、フェアな戦いができるのですが、
このゲームはキラー側に操作がしずらく、非常にストレスがかかるゲームでした。

ゲーム性は楽しむことができましたが、プレイする上でキラー側に
非常にストレスを感じるゲームでした。

また、ある程度課金しなければ強いパーク（スキルのようなもの）が手に入らなく、
個人の実力でカバーできるゲームに比べ、プレイする上でハンデが大きいです。

もう少しゲームをプレイするうえで、操作性、快適にプレイできる環境を整えていただきたいです。

Dead by Daylight is a great game.  It's perfect for when you have a bad day and want to release stress or if you really love the slasher horror movie genre and want to be part of it. Each killer with own unique power allows for players of all play style to enjoy the game in their own way; like sneaking around and closing in? Try Ghostface, Wraith, or The shape. Enjoy FPS, go for Deathslinger or the Huntress. Or how about just playing mind games so they fall in to your traps? Try Trapper, Hag, or the Nightmare. Dead by daylight truly has something for everyone, if killing isn't your thing you can always try your hand at surviving, and helping others escape the trial grounds with you.

don't get fixed for months, a fucking stupid aim assist for killers that will make you miss and hit walls that the devs pretend doesn't fucking exist, condescending devs whenever people voice(especially killers) that something is fucked, survivors who get to deal with stupid long active frame for killer swings so when a weapon misses if they turn fast enough it'll still count because fuck you, half of implemented perks and addons being worthless and so much fun to dig through in the bloodweb for shit you actually want such as 90% of all Cannibal's addons now, Michael Bay version of Freddy, whatever the fuck they're doing with Freddy in general, Blight and Devs thinking anyone would want to pay money to smash into the awful geometry of their maps, awful events that just make people run around the map and do nothing rather then something new and fun, or we could just some more charms and snowman to annoy killers with, if you're still able to have fun with this game then that's good for you can but I can't anymore, I'll always hate you DBD for making me love you so much with mindgames and keeping horror in the mainstream gaming but I'll hate you for making your gameplay with this iconic genre be about fucking pallets and running around a circle, no wonder people try to master Nurse so they rarely have to deal with it, I can only hope something washes away this fucking mess from my memory but it won't because these all end up dying in a week or stay in early access or both, I can only hope that Leatherface game is good so that I never have to play this Unless you are willing to invest hundreds of hours into one of the least rewarding, most frustrating games ever, this is NOT for you. 

I have a lot of friends who have been trying to get me to play for a while. They all have >400 hours in game. Upon playing, about 9/10 matches were described to me as "just a bad match." Or, "Just a bad killer." And were some of the most frustrating, unfair experiences I've ever had in a game. The very rare "good" match was tolerable at best, with no sense of reward or accomplishment, but moreover a general sense of relief. 

In terms of gameplay, its slow. Incredibly slow. Walking is slow, every "action" simply includes holding down left click for up to 3 mintues. But there is no AFK. They've managed to ruin the possibility of distracting yourself from the boring tedium of pressing your index finger down by having random "skill checks" trigger which severely punish you if missed. 

The perk system is beyond me. I have spent almost all ridiculously long queue times reviewing perks, but the complexity of each perk (which there are hundreds of it seems) makes the information lost to me as soon as the match starts. For every benefit of the perk there are a dozen stipulations and special circumstances that must take place for the perk to be active, and even when I think I finally have a useful one, I discover there are a dozen killer perks that counter it in one way or another. 

All in all I have had one match that I remember in a positive light. The community is toxic, the devs seem to oppose community feedback, and there are several systems of progression in game, non of which are made clear but are all more complicated than the last. 

TL:DR don't expect to have any idea whats going on at any time (as several unexplained icons and effects can be on your screen at once) until you've invested a couple hundred hours into the game, and expect that first couple hundred hours to be an incredibly painful experience.

В этой игре приятно коротать вечера под пивом играя за сурва. За убийц же отдохнуть не получится, банально из-за самого факта игры 4 vs 1. Нет, играть то можно, правда расслабиться тебе не дадут, а веселые приседающие ребята с фонариками напомнят, почему у тебя везде стоит тёмная тема. За ~300 часов не встретил ни одного читера, подозреваю, что они охотятся только на блоггеров чтобы сделать им шоу. Гринд имеется, но он не особо жёсткий, плюсом разрабы время от времени подгоняют всякие подарки в виде внутриигровой валюты и проводят ивенты. Доната нет вовсе, только разве что косметика. В общем, круто.

- I dont even have my third perk slot unlocked
